repnme.cdata!:
Benin - National Parks Conservation and
            Management Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the National Parks
            Conservation and Management Program (NPCMP) in Benin was
            satisfactory, with an unlikely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impact, and satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower.  Lessons learned
            include:  the achievements of the NPCMP confirm the critical
            importance of involving local communities in the development
            of effective biodiversity conservation systems; the NPCMP
            seemed to have achieved the effective integration of
            conservation and development by combining a set of
            activities that had a clear and positive impact on the
            living conditions of the local populations; there was
            effective multi-donor financing; effective coordination
            mechanisms are key requirements for multi-donor
            interventions; and ensuring financial sustainability of
            biodiversity conservation agencies is key.

5083935.trustfund:
TF023658-GEF2 MSP BENIN : NATIONAL PARKS

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - National Parks Conservation and
            Management Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Parks Conservation and
            Management Program Project, will ensure sustainable
            management, and conservation of regional, and global
            bio-diversity in Benin, including fragile ecosystems in the
            northern areas. It will specifically, establish sustainable
            wildlife management, and bio-diversity conservation
            capacity, at both national, and local levels. The components
            are: 1) to provide program management, through planning and
            monitoring at the national level, of habitats and
            ecosystems, and, support actions on legal aspects, and
            regional cooperation, through training, and ecological
            monitoring; 2) to support natural resources conservation at
            the Pendjari National Park, through adequate management of
            the park and cynegetic areas, thus, enabling tourism, and
            hunting practices, and, includes community participation, at
            the local level, in the development of the Siri area, and,
            the Tanguieta - Porga/Batia axes; and, 3) to support
            conservation of the W National Park, also, through
            appropriate management of its park and cynegetic areas, and
            community involvement. While the global environmental
            objective, will ensure long-term conservation of the
            country's bio-diversity, operational objectives will
            ensure increased managerial capacity of partnerships, and
            local communities, and, institutional capacity building will
            be supported through the Global Environmental Facility.
